com.groupone.p2pgame

Class CheckerMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.groupone.p2pgame.CheckerMove

  • public class CheckerMove
extends java.lang.Object
    CheckerMove stores an arbitrary game move that may or may not be valid. Each CheckerMove is made up of a start and end square position.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CheckerMove(CheckerSquare start, CheckerSquare end)
      Initialize a new CheckerMove.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CheckerSquare getEnd()
      Get the end square of the move.
      CheckerSquare getStart()
      Get the start square of the move.
      boolean isDoubleJump()
      Is the move a double jump? That is does the piece move two spaces diagonally.
      boolean isSingleJump()
      Is the move a single jump? That is does the piece move one space diagonally.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Convert the move into a human readable string.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CheckerMove

        public CheckerMove(CheckerSquare start,
           CheckerSquare end)
        Initialize a new CheckerMove.
        Parameters:
        start - The place where a piece was originally.
        end - The place where a piece will end up.

    • Method Detail

      • isDoubleJump

        public boolean isDoubleJump()
        Is the move a double jump? That is does the piece move two spaces diagonally. (Note: does not check if there is anything between to make it a valid move; this is done in CheckerBoardState).
        Returns:
        The answer to the above question.
        See Also:
        CheckerBoardState

      • isSingleJump

        public boolean isSingleJump()
        Is the move a single jump? That is does the piece move one space diagonally. (Note: only checks for locations, no other checking is done.)
        Returns:
        The answer to the above question.
        See Also:
        CheckerBoardState

      • getStart

        public CheckerSquare getStart()
        Get the start square of the move.
        Returns:
        The start square.

      • getEnd

        public CheckerSquare getEnd()
        Get the end square of the move.
        Returns:
        The end square.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert the move into a human readable string. Used in debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The move in string form, with coords.
